DiagnosticReport.presentedForm.definition: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent.

Encounter.classHistory.label: classHistory
Encounter.classHistory.definition: The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.  This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transitions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kind of discharge from emergency to inpatient.

Encounter.episodeOfCare.short: Episode(s) of care that this encounter should be recorded against
Encounter.episodeOfCare.definition: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

Encounter.participant.individual.definition: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient.

Encounter.period.definition: The start and end time of the encounter.

Encounter.length.definition: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.

Encounter.reasonCode.short: Coded reason the encounter takes place
Encounter.reasonCode.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

Encounter.reasonReference.label: reasonReference
Encounter.reasonReference.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

Encounter.diagnosis.condition.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

Encounter.diagnosis.use.label: use
Encounter.diagnosis.use.short: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge )

Encounter.diagnosis.rank.short: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type)
Encounter.diagnosis.rank.definition: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type).

Encounter.account.definition: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

Encounter.hospitalization.origin.label: origin
Encounter.hospitalization.origin.short: The location/organization from which the patient came before admission
Encounter.hospitalization.origin.definition: The location/organization from which the patient came before admission.

Encounter.hospitalization.admitSource.label: admitSource
Encounter.hospitalization.admitSource.short: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer)
Encounter.hospitalization.admitSource.definition: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer).

Encounter.hospitalization.reAdmission.label: reAdmission
Encounter.hospitalization.reAdmission.short: The type of hospital re-admission that has occurred (if any). If the value is absent, then this is not identified as a readmission
Encounter.hospitalization.reAdmission.definition: Whether this hospitalization is a readmission and why if known.

Encounter.hospitalization.dietPreference.label: dietPreference
Encounter.hospitalization.dietPreference.short: Diet preferences reported by the patient
Encounter.hospitalization.dietPreference.definition: Diet preferences reported by the patient.

Encounter.hospitalization.specialArrange.label: specialArrangement
Encounter.hospitalization.specialArrange.definition: Any special requests that have been made for this hospitalization encounter, such as the provision of specific equipment or other things.

Encounter.hospitalization.destination.label: destination
Encounter.hospitalization.destination.short: Location/organization to which the patient is discharged
Encounter.hospitalization.destination.definition: Location/organization to which the patient is discharged.

Encounter.hospitalization.dischargeDispo.short: Category or kind of location after discharge
Encounter.hospitalization.dischargeDispo.definition: Category or kind of location after discharge.

Encounter.location.location.label: location
Encounter.location.location.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.

Encounter.location.status.label: status
Encounter.location.status.definition: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.

Encounter.location.physicalType.label: physicalType
Encounter.location.physicalType.short: The physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierachy - bed room ward etc.)
Encounter.location.physicalType.definition: This will be used to specify the required levels (bed/ward/room/etc.) desired to be recorded to simplify either messaging or query.

Encounter.location.period.label: period
Encounter.location.period.short: Time period during which the patient was present at the location
Encounter.location.period.definition: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

Encounter.serviceProvider.label: serviceProvider
Encounter.serviceProvider.short: The organization (facility) responsible for this encounter
Encounter.serviceProvider.definition: The organization that is primarily responsible for this Encounter's services. This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different, such as if the actor performing the services was from an external organization (which may be billed seperately) for an external consultation.  Refer to the example bundle showing an abbreviated set of Encounters for a colonoscopy.

Encounter.partOf.label: partOf
Encounter.partOf.short: Another Encounter this encounter is part of
Encounter.partOf.definition: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

Goal.label: Goal
Goal.short: Describes the intended objective(s) for a patient, group or organization
Goal.definition: The US Core Goal Profile is based upon the core FHIR Goal Resource and created to meet the 2015 Edition Common Clinical Data Set 'Goals' requirements.

Goal.id.label: id
Goal.id.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

Goal.meta.label: meta
Goal.meta.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

Goal.implicitRules.label: implicitRules
Goal.implicitRules.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
Goal.implicitRules.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

Goal.language.label: language
Goal.language.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.

Goal.text.label: text
Goal.text.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
Goal.text.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

Goal.identifier.label: identifier
Goal.identifier.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this goal by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

Goal.lifecycleStatus.label: lifecycleStatus
Goal.lifecycleStatus.short: proposed | planned | accepted | active | on-hold | completed | cancelled | entered-in-error | rejected
Goal.lifecycleStatus.definition: The state of the goal throughout its lifecycle.

Goal.achievementStatus.label: achievementStatus
Goal.achievementStatus.short: in-progress | improving | worsening | no-change | achieved | sustaining | not-achieved | no-progress | not-attainable
Goal.achievementStatus.definition: Describes the progression, or lack thereof, towards the goal against the target.

Goal.category.label: category
Goal.category.definition: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

Goal.priority.label: priority
Goal.priority.definition: Identifies the mutually agreed level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the goal.

Goal.description.label: description
Goal.description.definition: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".

Goal.subject.label: subject
Goal.subject.short: Who this goal is intended for
Goal.subject.definition: Identifies the patient, group or organization for whom the goal is being established.

Goal.start[x].label: start[x]
Goal.start[x].definition: The date or event after which the goal should begin being pursued.

Goal.target.label: target
Goal.target.definition: Indicates what should be done by when.

Goal.target.id.label: id
Goal.target.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Goal.target.measure.label: measure
Goal.target.measure.short: The parameter whose value is being tracked
Goal.target.measure.definition: The parameter whose value is being tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

Goal.target.detail[x].label: detail[x]
Goal.target.detail[x].short: The target value to be achieved
Goal.target.detail[x].definition: The target value of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds, 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or above the low value.

Goal.target.due[x].label: due[x]
Goal.target.due[x].definition: Indicates either the date or the duration after start by which the goal should be met.

Goal.statusDate.label: statusDate
Goal.statusDate.definition: Identifies when the current status.  I.e. When initially created, when achieved, when cancelled, etc.

Goal.statusReason.label: statusReason
Goal.statusReason.definition: Captures the reason for the current status.

Goal.expressedBy.label: expressedBy
Goal.expressedBy.definition: Indicates whose goal this is - patient goal, practitioner goal, etc.

Goal.addresses.label: addresses
Goal.addresses.definition: The identified conditions and other health record elements that are intended to be addressed by the goal.

Goal.note.label: note
Goal.note.definition: Any comments related to the goal.

Goal.outcomeCode.label: outcomeCode
Goal.outcomeCode.short: What result was achieved regarding the goal?
Goal.outcomeCode.definition: Identifies the change (or lack of change) at the point when the status of the goal is assessed.

Goal.outcomeReference.label: outcomeReference
Goal.outcomeReference.definition: Details of what's changed (or not changed).

Immunization.identifier.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

Immunization.status.label: status
Immunization.status.definition: Indicates the current status of the immunization event.

Immunization.statusReason.label: statusReason
Immunization.statusReason.definition: Indicates the reason the immunization event was not performed.

Immunization.vaccineCode.label: vaccineCode
Immunization.vaccineCode.definition: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

Immunization.patient.label: patient
Immunization.patient.definition: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

Immunization.encounter.label: encounter
Immunization.encounter.definition: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

Immunization.occurrence[x].label: occurrence[x]
Immunization.occurrence[x].definition: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.

Immunization.recorded.label: recorded
Immunization.recorded.short: When the immunization was first captured in the subject's record
Immunization.recorded.definition: The date the occurrence of the immunization was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

Immunization.primarySource.label: primarySource
Immunization.primarySource.short: Indicates context the data was recorded in
Immunization.primarySource.definition: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.

Immunization.reportOrigin.label: reportOrigin
Immunization.reportOrigin.short: Indicates the source of a secondarily reported record
Immunization.reportOrigin.definition: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.

Immunization.location.label: location
Immunization.location.definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

Immunization.lotNumber.label: lotNumber
Immunization.lotNumber.definition: Lot number of the  vaccine product.

Immunization.site.label: site
Immunization.site.definition: Body site where vaccine was administered.

Immunization.route.label: route
Immunization.route.definition: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

Immunization.doseQuantity.label: doseQuantity
Immunization.doseQuantity.definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

Immunization.performer.label: performer
Immunization.performer.definition: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

Immunization.performer.function.short: What type of performance was done
Immunization.performer.function.definition: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

Immunization.performer.actor.label: actor
Immunization.performer.actor.short: Individual or organization who was performing
Immunization.performer.actor.definition: The practitioner or organization who performed the action.

Immunization.note.label: note
Immunization.note.definition: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

Immunization.reasonCode.label: reasonCode
Immunization.reasonCode.definition: Reasons why the vaccine was administered.

Immunization.reasonReference.label: reasonReference
Immunization.reasonReference.definition: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

Immunization.isSubpotent.label: isSubpotent
Immunization.isSubpotent.definition: Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.

Immunization.subpotentReason.label: subpotentReason
Immunization.subpotentReason.definition: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

Immunization.education.reference.label: reference
Immunization.education.reference.definition: Reference pointer to the educational material given to the patient if the information was on line.

Immunization.education.publicationDate.label: publicationDate
Immunization.education.publicationDate.definition: Date the educational material was published.

Immunization.education.presentationDate.label: presentationDate
Immunization.education.presentationDate.definition: Date the educational material was given to the patient.

Immunization.programEligibility.label: programEligibility
Immunization.programEligibility.short: Patient eligibility for a vaccination program
Immunization.programEligibility.definition: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

Immunization.fundingSource.definition: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).

2) HIBCC:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI,

Location.hoursOfOperation.daysOfWeek.label: daysOfWeek
Location.hoursOfOperation.daysOfWeek.short: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
Location.hoursOfOperation.daysOfWeek.definition: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

Location.hoursOfOperation.allDay.label: allDay
Location.hoursOfOperation.allDay.short: The Location is open all day
Location.hoursOfOperation.allDay.definition: The Location is open all day.

Location.availabilityExceptions.label: availabilityExceptions
Location.availabilityExceptions.definition: A description of when the locations opening ours are different to normal, e.g. public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal site availability as detailed in the opening hours Times.

Location.endpoint.label: endpoint
Location.endpoint.short: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location
Location.endpoint.definition: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location.

Medication.code.label: code
Medication.code.definition: A code (or set of codes) that specify this medication, or a textual description if no code is available. Usage note: This could be a standard medication code such as a code from RxNorm, SNOMED CT, IDMP etc. It could also be a national or local formulary code, optionally with translations to other code systems.

Medication.status.label: status
Medication.status.definition: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use.

Medication.manufacturer.label: manufacturer
Medication.manufacturer.definition: Describes the details of the manufacturer of the medication product.  This is not intended to represent the distributor of a medication product.

Medication.form.label: form
Medication.form.definition: Describes the form of the item.  Powder; tablets; capsule.

Medication.amount.label: amount
Medication.amount.definition: Specific amount of the drug in the packaged product.  For example, when specifying a product that has the same strength (For example, Insulin glargine 100 unit per mL solution for injection), this attribute provides additional clarification of the package amount (For example, 3 mL, 10mL, etc.).

Medication.ingredient.label: ingredient
Medication.ingredient.definition: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.

Medication.ingredient.id.label: id
Medication.ingredient.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Medication.ingredient.item[x].label: item[x]
Medication.ingredient.item[x].definition: The actual ingredient - either a substance (simple ingredient) or another medication of a medication.

Medication.ingredient.isActive.label: isActive
Medication.ingredient.isActive.definition: Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

Medication.ingredient.strength.label: strength
Medication.ingredient.strength.definition: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication.  For example, 250 mg per tablet.  This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet.

Medication.batch.label: batch
Medication.batch.definition: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

Medication.batch.lotNumber.definition: The assigned lot number of a batch of the specified product.

Medication.batch.expirationDate.label: expirationDate
Medication.batch.expirationDate.definition: When this specific batch of product will expire.

MedicationRequest.definition: The US Core Medication Request (Order) Profile is based upon the core FHIR MedicationRequest Resource and created to meet the 2015 Edition Common Clinical Data Set 'Medications' requirements.

MedicationRequest.identifier.label: identifier
MedicationRequest.identifier.definition: Identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

MedicationRequest.status.label: status
MedicationRequest.status.short: active | on-hold | cancelled | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | draft | unknown
MedicationRequest.status.definition: A code specifying the current state of the order.  Generally, this will be active or completed state.

MedicationRequest.statusReason.label: statusReason
MedicationRequest.statusReason.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.

MedicationRequest.intent.label: intent
MedicationRequest.intent.short: proposal | plan | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
MedicationRequest.intent.definition: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.

MedicationRequest.category.label: category
MedicationRequest.category.definition: Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).

MedicationRequest.priority.label: priority
MedicationRequest.priority.definition: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

MedicationRequest.doNotPerform.label: doNotPerform
MedicationRequest.doNotPerform.short: True if request is prohibiting action
MedicationRequest.doNotPerform.definition: If true indicates that the provider is asking for the medication request not to occur.

MedicationRequest.reported[x].label: reported[x]
MedicationRequest.reported[x].definition: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record.  It may also indicate the source of the report.

MedicationRequest.medication[x].label: medication[x]
MedicationRequest.medication[x].definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

MedicationRequest.subject.label: subject
MedicationRequest.subject.short: Who or group medication request is for
MedicationRequest.subject.definition: A link to a resource representing the person or set of individuals to whom the medication will be given.

MedicationRequest.encounter.label: encounter
MedicationRequest.encounter.short: Encounter created as part of encounter/admission/stay
MedicationRequest.encounter.definition: The Encounter during which this [x] was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

MedicationRequest.supportingInformation.label: supportingInformation
MedicationRequest.supportingInformation.short: Information to support ordering of the medication
MedicationRequest.supportingInformation.definition: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

MedicationRequest.authoredOn.label: authoredOn
MedicationRequest.authoredOn.definition: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

MedicationRequest.requester.label: requester
MedicationRequest.requester.definition: The individual, organization, or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

MedicationRequest.performer.label: performer
MedicationRequest.performer.definition: The specified desired performer of the medication treatment (e.g. the performer of the medication administration).

MedicationRequest.performerType.label: performerType
MedicationRequest.performerType.short: Desired kind of performer of the medication administration
MedicationRequest.performerType.definition: Indicates the type of performer of the administration of the medication.

MedicationRequest.recorder.label: recorder
MedicationRequest.recorder.definition: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

MedicationRequest.reasonCode.label: reasonCode
MedicationRequest.reasonCode.short: Reason or indication for ordering or not ordering the medication
MedicationRequest.reasonCode.definition: The reason or the indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.

MedicationRequest.reasonReference.label: reasonReference
MedicationRequest.reasonReference.short: Condition or observation that supports why the prescription is being written
MedicationRequest.reasonReference.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

MedicationRequest.instantiatesCanonical.label: instantiatesCanonical
MedicationRequest.instantiatesCanonical.definition: The URL pointing to a protocol, guideline, orderset, or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

MedicationRequest.instantiatesUri.label: instantiatesUri
MedicationRequest.instantiatesUri.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

MedicationRequest.basedOn.label: basedOn
MedicationRequest.basedOn.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

MedicationRequest.groupIdentifier.label: groupIdentifier
MedicationRequest.groupIdentifier.short: Composite request this is part of
MedicationRequest.groupIdentifier.definition: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition or prescription.

MedicationRequest.courseOfTherapyType.label: courseOfTherapyType
MedicationRequest.courseOfTherapyType.definition: The description of the overall patte3rn of the administration of the medication to the patient.

MedicationRequest.insurance.label: insurance
MedicationRequest.insurance.definition: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

MedicationRequest.note.label: note
MedicationRequest.note.definition: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.label: dosageInstruction
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.short: How the medication should be taken
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.id.label: id
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.exte.label: extension
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.exte.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.modi.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.modi.definition:

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.sequ.label: sequence
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.sequ.short: The order of the dosage instructions
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.sequ.definition: Indicates the order in which the dosage instructions should be applied or interpreted.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.text.label: text
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.text.short: Free text dosage instructions e.g. SIG
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.text.definition: Free text dosage instructions e.g. SIG.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.addi.label: additionalInstruction
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.addi.short: Supplemental instruction or warnings to the patient - e.g. "with meals", "may cause drowsiness"
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.addi.definition: Supplemental instructions to the patient on how to take the medication  (e.g. "with meals" or"take half to one hour before food") or warnings for the patient about the medication (e.g. "may cause drowsiness" or "avoid exposure of skin to direct sunlight or sunlamps").

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.pati.label: patientInstruction
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.pati.definition: Instructions in terms that are understood by the patient or consumer.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.asNe.label: asNeeded[x]
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.asNe.definition: Indicates whether the Medication is only taken when needed within a specific dosing schedule (Boolean option), or it indicates the precondition for taking the Medication (CodeableConcept).

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.label: id
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.label: extension
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.label: type
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.short: The kind of dose or rate specified
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.definition: The kind of dose or rate specified, for example, ordered or calculated.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.label: rate[x]
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.short: Amount of medication per unit of time
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.dose.definition: Amount of medication per unit of time.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.label: maxDosePerPeriod
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.short: Upper limit on medication per unit of time
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.definition: Upper limit on medication per unit of time.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.label: maxDosePerAdministration
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.short: Upper limit on medication per administration
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.definition: Upper limit on medication per administration.

MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.label: maxDosePerLifetime
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.short: Upper limit on medication per lifetime of the patient
MedicationRequest.dosageInstruction.maxD.definition: Upper limit on medication per lifetime of the patient.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.label: dispenseRequest
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.definition: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order).  Note that this information is not always sent with the order.  There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.id.label: id
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.extens.label: extension
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.extens.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.label: initialFill
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.definition: Indicates the quantity or duration for the first dispense of the medication.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.label: id
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.label: extension
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.label: quantity
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.definition: The amount or quantity to provide as part of the first dispense.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.label: duration
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.initia.definition: The length of time that the first dispense is expected to last.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.dispen.label: dispenseInterval
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.dispen.short: Minimum period of time between dispenses
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.dispen.definition: The minimum period of time that must occur between dispenses of the medication.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.validi.label: validityPeriod
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.validi.short: Time period supply is authorized for
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.validi.definition: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.number.label: numberOfRepeatsAllowed
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.number.definition: An integer indicating the number of times, in addition to the original dispense, (aka refills or repeats) that the patient can receive the prescribed medication. Usage Notes: This integer does not include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus "3 repeats", then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets.  A prescriber may explicitly say that zero refills are permitted after the initial dispense.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.quanti.label: quantity
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.quanti.short: Amount of medication to supply per dispense
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.quanti.definition: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.expect.label: expectedSupplyDuration
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.expect.short: Number of days supply per dispense
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.expect.definition: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.

MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.perfor.label: performer
MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.perfor.definition: Indicates the intended dispensing Organization specified by the prescriber.

MedicationRequest.substitution.label: substitution
MedicationRequest.substitution.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

MedicationRequest.substitution.id.label: id
MedicationRequest.substitution.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

MedicationRequest.substitution.allowed[x.label: allowed[x]
MedicationRequest.substitution.allowed[x.short: Whether substitution is allowed or not
MedicationRequest.substitution.allowed[x.definition: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

MedicationRequest.substitution.reason.label: reason
MedicationRequest.substitution.reason.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.

MedicationRequest.priorPrescription.label: priorPrescription
MedicationRequest.priorPrescription.short: An order/prescription that is being replaced
MedicationRequest.priorPrescription.definition: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

MedicationRequest.detectedIssue.label: detectedIssue
MedicationRequest.detectedIssue.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

MedicationRequest.eventHistory.label: eventHistory

Observation.partOf.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

Observation.code.label: code
Observation.code.definition: The test that was performed.  A LOINC **SHALL** be used if the concept is present in LOINC.

Observation.subject.label: subject
Observation.subject.short: Who and/or what the observation is about
Observation.subject.definition: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device this observation is about and into whose record the observation is placed. If the actual focus of the observation is different from the subject (or a sample of, part, or region of the subject), the `focus` element or the `code` itself specifies the actual focus of the observation.

Observation.focus.label: focus
Observation.focus.short: What the observation is about, when it is not about the subject of record
Observation.focus.definition: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.

Observation.encounter.label: encounter
Observation.encounter.short: Healthcare event during which this observation is made
Observation.encounter.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

Observation.effective[x].label: effective[x]
Observation.effective[x].definition: For lab tests this is the specimen collection date.  For Ask at Order Entry Questions (AOE)'s this is the date the question was asked.

Observation.issued.label: issued
Observation.issued.short: Date/Time this version was made available
Observation.issued.definition: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

Observation.performer.label: performer
Observation.performer.short: Who is responsible for the observation
Observation.performer.definition: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

Observation.value[x].label: value[x]
Observation.value[x].definition: The Laboratory result value.  If a coded value,  the valueCodeableConcept.code **SHOULD**  be selected from [SNOMED CT](http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/uslab-obs-codedresults).  If a numeric value, valueQuantity.code **SHALL** be selected from [UCUM](http://unitsofmeasure.org).  A FHIR [UCUM Codes value set](http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/valueset-ucum-units.html) that defines all UCUM codes is in the FHIR specification.

Observation.dataAbsentReason.label: dataAbsentReason
Observation.dataAbsentReason.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

Observation.interpretation.label: interpretation
Observation.interpretation.definition: A categorical assessment of an observation value.  For example, high, low, normal.

Observation.note.label: note
Observation.note.definition: Comments about the observation or the results.

Observation.bodySite.label: bodySite
Observation.bodySite.definition: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

Observation.method.label: method
Observation.method.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

Observation.specimen.label: specimen
Observation.specimen.definition: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

Observation.device.label: device

Observation.referenceRange.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.  Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR".   In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.

The low bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9). If the low bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is <=2.3).

Observation.referenceRange.high.label: high
Observation.referenceRange.high.definition: The value of the high bound of the reference range.  The high bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9). If the high bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is >= 2.3).

Observation.referenceRange.appliesTo.label: appliesTo
Observation.referenceRange.appliesTo.definition: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to.  For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race.  Multiple `appliesTo`  are interpreted as an "AND" of the target populations.  For example, to represent a target population of African American females, both a code of female and a code for African American would be used.

Observation.referenceRange.age.definition: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.

Observation.referenceRange.text.short: Text based reference range in an observation
Observation.referenceRange.text.definition: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation.  An example would be a reference value of "Negative" or a list or table of "normals".

Observation.hasMember.definition: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

Observation.derivedFrom.label: derivedFrom
Observation.derivedFrom.short: Related measurements the observation is made from
Observation.derivedFrom.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

Observation.component.definition: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes. Procedure.subject.label: subject
Procedure.subject.short: Who the procedure was performed on
Procedure.subject.definition: The person, animal or group on which the procedure was performed.

Procedure.encounter.label: encounter
Procedure.encounter.definition: The Encounter during which this Procedure was created or performed or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

Procedure.performed[x].label: performed[x]
Procedure.performed[x].definition: Estimated or actual date, date-time, period, or age when the procedure was performed.  Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

Procedure.recorder.label: recorder
Procedure.recorder.definition: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

Procedure.asserter.label: asserter
Procedure.asserter.definition: Individual who is making the procedure statement.

Procedure.performer.label: performer
Procedure.performer.short: The people who performed the procedure
Procedure.performer.definition: Limited to "real" people rather than equipment.

Procedure.performer.id.label: id
Procedure.performer.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Procedure.performer.extension.label: extension
Procedure.performer.extension.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

Procedure.performer.modifierExtension.label: modifierExtension
Procedure.performer.modifierExtension.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
Procedure.performer.modifierExtension.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

Procedure.performer.function.label: function
Procedure.performer.function.definition: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the procedure. For example, surgeon, anaesthetist, endoscopist.

Procedure.performer.actor.label: actor
Procedure.performer.actor.definition: The practitioner who was involved in the procedure.

Procedure.performer.onBehalfOf.label: onBehalfOf
Procedure.performer.onBehalfOf.short: Organization the device or practitioner was acting for
Procedure.performer.onBehalfOf.definition: The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

Procedure.location.label: location
Procedure.location.definition: The location where the procedure actually happened.  E.g. a newborn at home, a tracheostomy at a restaurant.

Procedure.reasonCode.label: reasonCode
Procedure.reasonCode.definition: The coded reason why the procedure was performed. This may be a coded entity of some type, or may simply be present as text.

Procedure.reasonReference.label: reasonReference
Procedure.reasonReference.short: The justification that the procedure was performed
Procedure.reasonReference.definition: The justification of why the procedure was performed.

Procedure.bodySite.label: bodySite
Procedure.bodySite.definition: Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion.

Procedure.outcome.label: outcome
Procedure.outcome.definition: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve the reasons for the procedure being performed?

Procedure.report.label: report
Procedure.report.short: Any report resulting from the procedure
Procedure.report.definition: This could be a histology result, pathology report, surgical report, etc.

Procedure.complication.label: complication
Procedure.complication.definition: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.

Procedure.complicationDetail.label: complicationDetail
Procedure.complicationDetail.short: A condition that is a result of the procedure
Procedure.complicationDetail.definition: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period.

Procedure.followUp.label: followUp
Procedure.followUp.definition: If the procedure required specific follow up - e.g. removal of sutures. The follow up may be represented as a simple note or could potentially be more complex, in which case the CarePlan resource can be used.

Procedure.note.label: note
Procedure.note.definition: Any other notes and comments about the procedure.

Procedure.focalDevice.label: focalDevice
Procedure.focalDevice.definition: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

Procedure.focalDevice.id.label: id
Procedure.focalDevice.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Procedure.focalDevice.extension.label: extension
Procedure.focalDevice.extension.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

Procedure.focalDevice.modifierExtension.label: modifierExtension
Procedure.focalDevice.modifierExtension.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
Procedure.focalDevice.modifierExtension.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

Procedure.focalDevice.action.label: action
Procedure.focalDevice.action.definition: The kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.

Procedure.focalDevice.manipulated.label: manipulated
Procedure.focalDevice.manipulated.definition: The device that was manipulated (changed) during the procedure.

Procedure.usedReference.label: usedReference
Procedure.usedReference.definition: Identifies medications, devices and any other substance used as part of the procedure.

Procedure.usedCode.label: usedCode
Procedure.usedCode.short: Coded items used during the procedure
Procedure.usedCode.definition: Identifies coded items that were used as part of the procedure.

Provenance.label: Provenance
Provenance.definition: The US Core Provenance Profile is based upon the Argonaut Data Query requirements.

Provenance.id.label: id
Provenance.id.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

Provenance.meta.label: meta
Provenance.meta.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

Provenance.implicitRules.label: implicitRules
Provenance.implicitRules.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
Provenance.implicitRules.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

Provenance.language.label: language
Provenance.language.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.

Provenance.text.label: text
Provenance.text.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
Provenance.text.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

Provenance.contained.label: contained
Provenance.contained.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

Provenance.extension.label: extension
Provenance.extension.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

Provenance.modifierExtension.label: modifierExtension
Provenance.modifierExtension.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

Provenance.target.label: target
Provenance.target.short: The Resource this Provenance record supports
Provenance.target.definition: The Reference(s) that were generated or updated by  the activity described in this resource. A provenance can point to more than one target if multiple resources were created/updated by the same activity.

Provenance.occurred[x].label: occurred[x]
Provenance.occurred[x].definition: The period during which the activity occurred.

Provenance.recorded.label: recorded
Provenance.recorded.short: Timestamp when the activity was recorded / updated
Provenance.recorded.definition: The instant of time at which the activity was recorded.

Provenance.policy.label: policy
Provenance.policy.short: Policy or plan the activity was defined by
Provenance.policy.definition: Policy or plan the activity was defined by. Typically, a single activity may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.

Provenance.location.label: location
Provenance.location.short: Where the activity occurred, if relevant
Provenance.location.definition: Where the activity occurred, if relevant.

Provenance.reason.label: reason
Provenance.reason.definition: The reason that the activity was taking place.

Provenance.activity.label: activity
Provenance.activity.definition: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

Provenance.agent.label: agent
Provenance.agent.definition: The entity that provided the copy to your system.

Provenance.agent.id.label: id
Provenance.agent.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Provenance.agent.extension.label: extension
Provenance.agent.extension.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

Provenance.agent.modifierExtension.label: modifierExtension
Provenance.agent.modifierExtension.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
Provenance.agent.modifierExtension.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

Provenance.agent.type.label: type
Provenance.agent.type.definition: The participation the agent had with respect to the activity.

Provenance.agent.role.label: role
Provenance.agent.role.definition: The function of the agent with respect to the activity. The security role enabling the agent with respect to the activity.

Provenance.agent.who.label: who
Provenance.agent.who.definition: The individual, device or organization that participated in the event.

Provenance.agent.onBehalfOf.label: onBehalfOf
Provenance.agent.onBehalfOf.definition: The individual, device, or organization for whom the change was made.

Provenance.entity.label: entity
Provenance.entity.short: An entity used in this activity
Provenance.entity.definition: An entity used in this activity.

Provenance.entity.id.label: id
Provenance.entity.id.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Provenance.entity.extension.label: extension
Provenance.entity.extension.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

Provenance.entity.modifierExtension.label: modifierExtension
Provenance.entity.modifierExtension.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
Provenance.entity.modifierExtension.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

Provenance.entity.role.label: role
Provenance.entity.role.definition: How the entity was used during the activity.

Provenance.entity.what.label: what
Provenance.entity.what.definition: Identity of the  Entity used. May be a logical or physical uri and maybe absolute or relative.

Provenance.entity.agent.label: agent
Provenance.entity.agent.short: Entity is attributed to this agent
Provenance.entity.agent.definition: The entity is attributed to an agent to express the agent's responsibility for that entity, possibly along with other agents. This description can be understood as shorthand for saying that the agent was responsible for the activity which generated the entity.

Provenance.signature.label: signature
Provenance.signature.definition: A digital signature on the target Reference(s). The signer should match a Provenance.agent. The purpose of the signature is indicated.
